item.title: Seizure Romero add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I cannot sleep unless I am surrounded by books." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Seizure Romero add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Seizure Romero add a quote by Nelson Algren
item.description: "Never play cards with a man called Doc. Never eat at a place called Mom's. Never sleep with a woman whose troubles are worse than your own." -- Nelson Algren

item.title: Seizure Romero add a quote by Charles Stross
item.description: "Any civilization where the main symbol of religious veneration is a tool of execution is a bad place to have children." -- Charles Stross

item.title: Seizure Romero add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "Every normal man must be tempted, at times, to spit on his hands, hoist the black flag, and begin slitting throats." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Seizure Romero add a quote by Robert Heinlein
item.description: "A poet who reads his verse in public may have other nasty habits." -- Robert Heinlein

item.title: Seizure Romero add a quote by Martin Booth
item.description: "I enjoy books. No room is fit for occupation without a lining of books." -- Martin Booth

item.title: Seizure Romero add a quote by Cory Doctorow
item.description: "We are the people of the book. We love our books. We fill our houses with books. We treasure books we inherit from our parents, and we cherish the idea of passing those books on to our children. Indeed, how many of us started reading with a beloved book that belonged to one of our parents? We force worthy books on our friends, and we insist that they read them. We even feel a weird kinship for the people we see on buses or airplanes reading our books, the books that we claim. If anyone tries to take away our books—some oppressive government, some censor gone off the rails—we would defend them with everything that we have. We know our tribespeople when we visit their homes because every wall is lined with books. There are teetering piles of books beside the bed and on the floor; there are masses of swollen paperbacks in the bathroom. Our books are us. They are our outboard memory banks and they contain the moral, intellectual, and imaginative influences that make us the people we are today." -- Cory Doctorow

item.title: Seizure Romero add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "What I say is, a town isn't a town without a bookstore. It may call itself a town, but unless it's got a bookstore it knows it's not fooling a soul." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Seizure Romero add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "It is likely I will die next to a pile of things I was meaning to read." -- Lemony Snicket
